attributes.action: Allow actively gay men and women to have the right to give blood donations.
attributes.additional_details: France have recently ammended the guidelines for giving blood allowing gay men and women in France to donate blood. Why cant we do the same? This saves lifes.
attributes.background:
Gay men and women cant currently donate blood.

I ask why is this? And challange it.

When a person gives blood to save another it is a selfless act of kindness, which gay men and women should also have the right to do. When giving blood, the blood gets tested to strict guidelines.

rejection.details:
This petition relates to the ban on gay men giving blood:

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/106707

There are no specific restrictions on gay women giving blood:

http://www.nhs.uk/Conditions/Blood-donation/Pages/Who-can-use-it.aspx
